I have to have a reincission next week for cleaner margins and to test lymph nodes. if the lymph nodes are clear the chemo will only benefit me 4 percent. I think I will refuse chemo and talke my chances. I was just looking for people to agree with me giving all that I have researched about bc. I the breast cancer comes back then I will worry about chemo. I have also read that 60 percent of all IDC will never spread beyond the breast left untreated. So I will do the radiation and thats it. The onco left it up to me.

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 07:43PM icey wrote: Dear Vicky, I understand a diagnosis can be very unsetting but don't think the worst. After your surgery and you get a treatment plan you will feel much better. Most women who get breast cancer after menopause have a lot better prognosis than younger women. Did the biopsy show if it was er or pr positive. Most breast cancer are and there are hormone therphy to treat them. I was terrified 2 years ago and I am cancer free. I was dx soon after my very first mammogram. I had a lumpectomy and radiation which both for me was a lot easier than I thought they would be. Just take one step at a time and don't expect the worst.Hugs to you.

Posts.Title: swell under arm help icey DaylilyFan

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2010 04:15PM icey wrote: I had a lumpectomy one year ago on oct 28 and then a reincision in jan. Both were a peice of cake. They gave me pain meds when I woke up from surgery.but after I came home I just took iburphroin. Keep in mind I am very scared of any kind of surgery. The hardest part of the whole experience was siminal node biopsy. I kept swelling under the arm but it was just uncomfortable and anoying not really painful.  The radiation wasn't bad either. Used lubriderm and it went well. Skin turned red but did not burn. Any cancer treatment is not fun but it was nearly as bad as I had imagined.
Posts.Title: lumpectomy surgery bbboysmom Karen09

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2010 12:47PM icey wrote: Hi, I am having a reincission next wednesday to get clean margins. My tumor was 2 cm and grade 1. So I think a mastectomy would be over doing it. The way I feel about it if the cancer comes back I can always have a mastectomy but u can't put your breast back on after it is gone. It si a proven face that lumpectomy and radiation is just as effective as mastectomy so I would do more research yourself and make sure of what u want to do. An educated decison would be your best decision not one that is brought on by fear. I know it is a hard decison to make and you want to make the right one. I was like u at first. I wanted them both removed but I have since changed my mind because a mastectomy does mean it less likely to come back as compared to lumpectomy and rads. Good luck.
Posts.Title: help needed alison34 icey

Posts.Content: icey wrote: I was wonder if anyone was diagnosised with cancer of unknown primary before figuring out it was breast cancer mets. I have stage 2 breast cancer in 2009. Had lumpectomy then radiation. 6 year later a 3 cm mass found on the lung. After 2 different hospitals looking at biopsy they decided it was another primary. Stage 3 lung cancer. So chemo radiation. Basically treatment for last year and a half. Then a met growing right below shoulder about 3cm showed up on pet along with 1 bone met. So had needle biopsy on met and the said it was breast cancer not lung but they did not get enough to tissue to test for hormone receptors. So have surgery to remove lump 2 weeks ago. Still waiting on results!!! I called last Monday to see if results are back. I was told they needed to order more stains and right now they have cancer with unknown primary. Has anyone had this problem? I don't really know if I have stage 4 breast cancer or stage 4 lung cancer or both Dx 10/28/2009, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: questions about radiation icey kmf

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2010 07:33AM icey wrote: Dear Hannabeth. Even though stage 4 is bad news and not cureable it is treatable. The good news is that u are er and pr positive. Tamox works better than chemo for this type of cancer. I have a friend stage 4 and all she is on is tamoxifen and zometa and doing great. They can't even find bone mets or liver mets she had when she was diagnosised. They are gone thanks to the tamoxfen. Also studies have shown a better outcome with zometa added. She did not have surgery either because the cancer had already spread. The doctor didn't see any reason to put her through surgery. So the doctors are treating you right and they are not giving up on you. I think u will be around for a long time. There are women on these boards with stage 4 that they have had for 20 years. So take care and try not to freak out the tamoxfen will keep the cancer under control. Good luck Icey

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2010 03:02AM icey wrote: Dear balkinhope, Some of the ladies on here will correct me if i am wrong. But radiation is used on met to relieve pain and make u more comfortable. As far as the zometa, A recent study is being done because there is evidence that zometa not only helps bone met but can keep cancer a bay. Patients on zometa do better than patient who do with out it. My friends sister has stage 4 and she is on tamoxifen and zometa and they can't find any mets anywhere now. They were in her liver and bone.
